product.name: HyperView Player - HyperView Player: Versions 2021.1.0.27 and prior

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: The software performs operations on a memory buffer but can read from or write to a memory location outside of the intended boundary of the buffer. This hits initially as a read access violation, leading to a memory corruption situation.CVE-2022-2947 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Mitigation measures have been added to the latest version of HyperView Player v2022.1. Altair One recommends users apply the update to mitigate these vulnerabilities.

notes.text: The affected product is vulnerable to the use of uninitialized memory vulnerability during parsing of H3D files. A DWORD is extracted from an uninitialized buffer and, after sign extension, is used as an index into a stack variable to increment a counter leading to memory corruption.CVE-2022-2949 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
